text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.4.41, IDRS Terminal Input, Command Code UNLCE.
IRM 2.4.41, dated June 12, 2014, is superseded.
Table of Contents

with Deﬁner “C ” — Input Screen Format with an EIN as the Primary TIN with Deﬁner ’C’ — Input Screen Format with an SSN as the Primary with Deﬁner ’D’ — Input Display with an EIN as the Primary TIN with Deﬁner ’D’ — Input Display with a SSN as the Primary TIN with Deﬁner ‘V’ — Input Display with SSN as the Primary TIN
UNLCE
page (
) This subsection outlines the procedures for using the command code (CC) UNLCE to access and update the
%-PENALTY-FILE. The FILE is a relational database that stores information about Form
(Request for
% Penalty Assessment). The
%-PENALTY-FILE is not to be confused with the TIF (Taxpayer Information File). The information on the
%-PENALTY-FILE will not be systematically updated by any information that is on the TIF. (
) The CC UNLCE, along with one of ﬁve deﬁners, will allow an individual to research, establish, change and delete
% penalty cross-reference tion on the
%-PENALTY-FILE using IDRS. The ﬁve deﬁners are space, “C”, “D”, and “V”. (
) The
%-PENALTY-FILE will contain cross-reference information concerning the
% penalty assessments that have been made against corporations the responsible officers of those corporations. The
%-PENALTY-FILE will initially be empty when the CC UNLCE goes into production. The
%- PENALTY-FILE will be built and modiﬁed with the use of the CC UNLCE with deﬁner of space, “C”, “D”, or “V”. (
) Only the research capability (CC UNLCE with deﬁner “R”) is allowed at a Universal Location Office site. (
) The
%-PENALTY-FILE is systematically updated by a batch program similar to the CC UNLCE. (
) A
position history item is allowed as input on to the Officer and Records. (
) CC UNLCE with deﬁner “R” is used to research
% penalty information on the
%-PENALTY-FILE utilizing IDRS. Information can be searched about a corporation or about any of the responsible officers of a corporation. (
) CC UNLCE with deﬁner space is used to establish a corporation or officer account on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. The ﬁrst step will be to enter the CC UNLCE, the deﬁner space and a corporation TIN (EIN) on line
In response, one of two screen formats will be displayed. The information that be input with each of these screen formats must be input on designated line numbers. See Exhibits
and
for the designated line (
) CC UNLCE with deﬁner “C” is used to change information on or add informa- tion to the
%-PENALTY-FILE for a corporation or responsible officer account that is presently on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. The information that is being input must be entered on designated line numbers. See Exhibits
and
for the designated line numbers. The CC UNLCE deﬁner “R” is a prerequisite for using the CC UNLCE with deﬁner “C”. (
) CC UNLCE with deﬁner “D” is used to delete information from the
%- PENALTY-FILE for a corporation or responsible officer. The information that is being deleted must be entered on designated lines. See Exhibits
and
for the designated line numbers. The CC UNLCE with deﬁner “R” is a prerequisite for using the CC UNLCE with deﬁner “D”.
(01-01-2006) CC UNLCE with Deﬁners

CC UNLCE with deﬁner “D” is used to delete information from the 100%- PENALTY-FILE for a corporation or responsible officer. The information that is being deleted must be entered on designated lines. See Exhibits 2.4.41–11 and 2.4.41–12 for the designated line numbers. The CC UNLCE with deﬁner “R” is a prerequisite for using the CC UNLCE with deﬁner “D”.
CC UNLCE with deﬁner “V” is used to change the validity of a responsible officer SSN without having to delete the invalid account and re
input informa
tion for the valid account, or vice versa. All data associated with the original account
including MFTs, Tax Periods, assessment amounts, history items, and Corporation links
will be retained on the new account. The CC UNLCE with deﬁner “R” is a prerequisite for using the CC UNLCE with deﬁner “V”.

officer SSN without having to delete the invalid account and re-input tion for the valid account, or vice versa. All data associated with the original account - including MFTs, Tax Periods, assessment amounts, history items, and Corporation links - will be retained on the new account. The CC with deﬁner “R” is a prerequisite for using the CC UNLCE with deﬁner “V”. (
) INVALID DEFINER — The Deﬁner input was not space, “R”, “C”, “ D”, or (
) TIN INVALID — TIN and FILE SOURCE input for responsible officer, or ration, did not meet standard validity criteria. Correct and re-enter. (
) TIN MISMATCH WITH STORED DATA — TIN and FILE SOURCE did not match TIN and FILE SOURCE stored in the SIR from the previous input. (
) ULC INVALID — The ULC input does not meet standard validity criteria. Correct and re-enter. (
) ULCAO INVALID — ULCAO assignment code input does not meet validity criteria. Correct and re-enter. (
) COMMAND CODE INITIALIZATION INVALID — The prior entry was not the CC UNLCE with either deﬁner “R”, “C”, “D”, or “V”. (
) CORPORATION NAME LINE INVALID — Name line exceeds
characters begins with a blank. Note: Valid entries for a corporation name line are A–Z,
, hyphen, and blank. Correct and re-enter. (
) RESPONSIBLE OFFICER NAME INVALID — Name line exceeds

ters or does not begin with a letter of the alphabet. Note: Valid entries for a responsible officer name line are A–Z, hyphen and In addition, a right-handed bracket “ ]” must be entered between the ﬁrst last name of the responsible officer. Correct and re-enter.
TIN INVALID — TIN and FILE SOURCE input for responsible officer, or corpo- ration, did not meet standard validity criteria. Correct and re-enter.
TIN MISMATCH WITH STORED DATA — TIN and FILE SOURCE did not match TIN and FILE SOURCE stored in the SIR from the previous input.
Note: Valid entries for a corporation name line are A–Z, 0–9, hyphen, ampersand and blank. Correct and re-enter.
) RESPONSIBLE OFFICER NAME INVALID — Name line exceeds

charac- ters or does not begin with a letter of the alphabet. Note: Valid entries for a responsible officer name line are A–Z, hyphen and blank. In addition, a right-handed bracket “ ]” must be entered between the ﬁrst and last name of the responsible officer. Correct and re-enter. (
) TAX MODULE NOT PRESENT ON ACCOUNT — Requested tax module is not present on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. (
) CORPORATE ACCT NOT ON PENALTY FILE — No information exists on the
%-PENALTY-FILE under this corporation TIN (EIN). (
) OFFICER ACCT NOT ON PENALTY FILE — No information exists on the
%-PENALTY-FILE under this responsible office TIN (SSN). (
) OFFICER ACCT ALREADY ON PENALTY FILE — A responsible officer record for this corporation has already been established on the
%-PENALTY-FILE using this responsible officer TIN (SSN). (
) NOT AN OFFICER OF THIS CORPORATION — A responsible officer account for this corporation has not been established on the
%-PENALTY-FILE using this TIN (SSN).
RESPONSIBLE OFFICER NAME INVALID — Name line exceeds 35 charac- ters or does not begin with a letter of the alphabet.

Valid entries for a responsible officer name line are A–Z, hyphen and blank. In addition, a right-handed bracket “ ]” must be entered between the ﬁrst and last name of the responsible officer. Correct and re-enter.
UNLCE
) ONLY ONE OFF. TAX MODULE ON FILE — The information for only one
% penalty assessment against this responsible officer is present on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. Therefore, the request to delete that information is denied. (
) ONLY ONE CORP. TAX MODULE ON FILE — The information for only one
% penalty assessment against this corporation is present on the
%- PENALTY-FILE. Therefore, the request to delete that information is denied. (
) ONLY ONE RESPONSIBLE OFF. ON FILE — The information for only one sponsible officer of this corporation is present on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. Therefore, the request to delete that information is denied. (
) MAX NUMBER OF ASSESSMENTS ON FILE — The information for a maximum of
% penalty assessments against a responsible officer of any given corporation can be stored on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. At present, information for
assessments that have been made against this officer (of the given corporation) is stored on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. (
) SCREEN INFORMATION INCOMPLETE — All the needed information was entered on the screen. Correct and re-enter. (
) DUPLICATE REQUEST — The MFT-CD and TAX-PRD for the same tax module has been entered more than once. Correct and re-enter. (
) “ALL” CAN ONLY BE USED WITH AN EIN — The literal “ALL” is allowed as input with a corporation TIN (EIN). (
) PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA ON SCREEN — The invalid element(s) will be asterisks. (
) INVALID ACCT ALREADY ON PENALTY FILE — The valid SSN that was with deﬁner “V” cannot be changed because the invalid SSN is already on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. (
) VALID ACCT ALREADY ON PENALTY FILE — The invalid SSN that was with deﬁner “V” cannot be changed because the valid SSN is already on the
%-PENALTY-FILE. (

) ACCOUNT CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE — An attempt to access from the data base was unsuccessful. Try again later.* Note: * If this message repeatedly appears when attempting to access an the account must be reactivated by deleting it and reentering all data. As normal deletion method won’t work without ﬁrst researching the account, this situation ONLY do the following: enter UNLCED followed by the EIN SSN on the
st line, and DELETE CORPORATION REC or DELETE OFFICER REC on the
nd line. (
) AREA DOWN-TRY LATER — The
% PENALTY AREA is down. Try later. (
) AREA RESTRICTED — The
% PENALTY AREA is restricted. Try again
ACCOUNT CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE — An attempt to access information from the data base was unsuccessful. Try again later.*

* If this message repeatedly appears when attempting to access an account, the account must be reactivated by deleting it and reentering all data. As the normal deletion method won’t work without ﬁrst researching the account, for this situation ONLY do the following: enter UNLCED followed by the EIN or SSN on the 1st line, and DELETE CORPORATION REC or DELETE
AREA DOWN-TRY LATER — The 100% PENALTY AREA is down. Try again
BETWEEN RUN UNITS — A rollback exception message.
) LONG RECOVERY IN PROGRESS — A rollback exception message. Try again later. (
) SHORT RECOVERY IN PROGRESS — A rollback exception message. Try again later.
2.4.41-1 (01-01-2002) UNLCE with Deﬁner Space or “ R” — Input Display with an EIN as the Primary TIN

The following is the screen format to use when researching information or establishing a corporation or a re- sponsible officer account on the 100%-PENALTY-FILE. If a corporation account is not present on the 100%- PENALTY-FILE under the TIN (EIN) entered on line 1, the format screen described in Exhibit 2.4.41–6 will displayed. Information about the corporation and one of the responsible officers of that corporation can then entered. If a corporation account is present on the 100%-PENALTY-FILE under the TIN (EIN) entered on the format screen described in Exhibit 2.4.41–8 will be displayed. The information for one new responsible officer of this corporation can then be entered.
Input Display:
Item Line Position Description and Validity 1 1 1–5 CC UNLCE 2 1 6 Deﬁner (“R” to research-space to establish) 3 1 7–17 Corporation TIN (Edited EIN) and FILE
Terminal Response:

Error Responses will be displayed on line 24 in inverse video. See messages in Section 41.3. Valid Response: If no errors are present for an entry, the information on line 1 will be redisplayed. The requested information will be displayed on lines 2 through 23.
The page information will be displayed on line 24 when the response consists of more than one page.
2.4.41-1 (Cont. 1) (01-01-2002) UNLCE with Deﬁner Space or “ R” — Input Display with an EIN as the Primary TIN

When researching information on the 100%-PENALTY-FILE for a given corporation, the number of output screens will vary depending on the number of assessments and the number of responsible officers of that poration.

*4 History information (ACTION-DT, ACTION-EMPLEE and ACTION) will be repeated as often as there are history items for the corporation.
Exhibit 2.4.41-3 (01-01-2002) CC UNLCE with Deﬁner ’R’ — Input Display with an SSN as the Primary TIN
The following is the screen format to use when researching information on the 100%-PENALTY-FILE concerning a given responsible officer:
Input Display:

Error Responses will be displayed on line 24 in inverse video. See messages in Section 41.3. Valid Response: If no errors are present for an entry, the information on line 1 will be redisplayed. The requested information will be displayed on lines 2 through 23.
The page information will be displayed on line 24 when the response consists of more than one page.

This format screen is generated when there is no information on the 100%-PENALTY-FILE under the TIN (EIN) entered on line 1. It is used to establish an account for a corporation, and an account for one of the responsible officers of that corporation, on the 100%-PENALTY-FILE.

*1 The information for up to eight 100% penalty assessments against the corporation can be entered on lines 4 through 11. (At least one must be entered).
*2 Overlay the literals on lines 4 and 15 with the pertinent information. The range for as- sessment amounts is .01–999,999,999.99
*3 A right-handed bracket ’]’ must be entered between the responsible officer’s ﬁrst and last name. Example JOHN]SMITH.
*4 The information for up to nine 100% penalty assessments against the officer can be entered on lines 15 through 23. (At least one must be entered).
Terminal Response:
a. Error Responses will be displayed on line 24 in inverse video. See messages in Section 41.3. All invalid elements will be asterisked. b. Valid Responses: “REQUEST COMPLETED ” displayed on line 24.

Exhibit 2.4.41-9 (07-01-2014) CC UNLCE with Deﬁner “C ” — Input Screen Format with an EIN as the Primary TIN
with Deﬁner “C ” — Input Screen Format with an EIN as the Primary TIN

The following is the Screen format to use when changing (1) the name line of a corporation (2) the ULCAO as- signment code, or (3) the amount of the 100% penalties assessed against this corporation. The following screen format can also be used to add the MFT code, tax period and assessment amount for assessments that have been made against this corporation to the 100%-PENALTY-FILE.

The CC UNLCE, deﬁner ’C’ and a corporation TIN (EIN) must be entered on line 1. Additional information will be entered on lines 2 through 23 when that information is being changed or added to the All information being entered must be entered on a designated line number. See the record element description below for the designated line numbers.

Item Line Position Description and 1 1 1–5 CC UNLCE 2 1 6 CC-DEFINER ’C’ 3 1 7–17 Corporation TIN (Edited EIN) and 4 1 23–28 ULCAO literal 5 1 30–33 CORP-ULCAO assignment code 6 1 38–44 O-D Literal 7 1 46 Defunct Code 8 2 1–35 Corporation Name 9 2 45–52 Review Code Literal 10 2 53 REVIEW CODE — 0, 1, 2, or 3. If 0, cant. If 1, reviewed. If 2, reviewed 3, reviewed, but not moved. 11 3 1–56 HISTORY ITEM 12 4–21 1–2 MFT-CD (01, 03, 09, 11, 12, 14, 16, 13 4–21 4–9 TAXPRD (YYYYMM) 14 4–21 11–24 *ASSESSMENT-AMT (left justiﬁed)
*ASSESSMENT-AMT (left justiﬁed)
NOTE: A change screen (deﬁner ’C’) must be preceded by a research screen (’R’).
Exhibit 2.4.41-10 (01-01-2013) CC UNLCE with Deﬁner ’C’ — Input Screen Format with an SSN as the Primary TIN
with Deﬁner ’C’ — Input Screen Format with an SSN as the Primary TIN

The following is the screen format to use when changing (1) the name line of a responsible officer, (2) the ULCAO assignment code, (3) the amount of 100% penalties assessed against a responsible officer of a given corporation. The following screen format can also be used to add the MFT code, tax period and assessment amount for assessments against a responsible officer of a given corporation.

The CC UNLCE, deﬁner ’C’ and a responsible officer TIN (SSN) must be entered on line 1. A corporation TIN (EIN) does not need to be entered on line 3 if the information for only the responsible officer name line or assignment code is being changed. Otherwise, a corporation TIN (EIN) must be entered on line 3 positions 1 through 11. Additional information will be entered on lines 2 through 23 when that information is being changed or added to the 100%-PENALTY-FILE. All information being entered must be entered on a designated line number. See the record element description below for the designated line numbers.
Input Display:
CC UNLCE CC-DEFINER ’C’ Responsible Officer TIN (Edited SSN) and FILE SOURCE ULCAO Literal ULCAO assignment code Officer Name Review Code Literal REVIEW CODE –

2.4.41-12 (01-01-2013) UNLCE with Deﬁner ’D’ — Input Display with a SSN as the Primary TIN
with Deﬁner ’D’ — Input Display with a SSN as the Primary TIN

The following screen format is used when the information for one or more of the 100% Penalties assessed against a responsible officer of a given corporation is being deleted from the 100%-PENALTY-FILE.
The CC UNLCE, deﬁner ’D’ and a responsible officer TIN (SSN) must be entered on line 1, and a corporation TIN (EIN) must be entered on line 2, when using this screen format.
Information will be entered on lines 3 through 23 when penalties assessed against a responsible officer are being deleted from the 100%-PENALTY-FILE.

2.4.41-13 (06-12-2017) UNLCE with Deﬁner ‘V’ — Input Display with SSN as the Primary TIN
The following screen is used when an invalid SSN is being changed to a valid SSN, or vice versa.
When using this screen the CC UNLCE, deﬁner ‘V’, and a responsible officer TIN (SSN) must be entered on line 1; a history item must be entered on line 3.
